metadata.name: Network Application Gateways
metadata.description: This module deploys a Network Application Gateway.
Optional. The resource ID(s) to assign to the resource.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. The name of the private endpoint.
Optional. The location to deploy the private endpoint to.
Optional. The name of the private link connection to create.
Required. The subresource to deploy the private endpoint for. For example "blob", "table", "queue" or "file".
Required. Resource ID of the subnet where the endpoint needs to be created.
Optional. The name of the Private DNS Zone Group.
Optional. The name of the private DNS zone group config.
Required. The resource id of the private DNS zone.
Required. The private DNS zone groups to associate the private endpoint. A DNS zone group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Optional. The private DNS zone group to configure for the private endpoint.
Optional. If Manual Private Link Connection is required.
Optional. A message passed to the owner of the remote resource with the manual connection request.
Optional. FQDN that resolves to private endpoint IP address.
Required. A list of private IP addresses of the private endpoint.
Optional. Custom DNS configurations.
Required. The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group.
Required. The ID of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to.
Required. The member name of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to.
Required. A private IP address obtained from the private endpoint's subnet.
Required. Properties of private endpoint IP configurations.
Optional. A list of IP configurations of the private endpoint. This will be used to map to the First Party Service endpoints.
Optional. Application security groups in which the private endpoint IP configuration is included.
Optional. The custom name of the network interface attached to the private endpoint.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Tags to be applied on all resources/resource groups in this deployment.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. Specify if you want to deploy the Private Endpoint into a different resource group than the main resource.
Optional. The name of diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `allLogs` to collect all logs.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable log collection.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `AllMetrics` to collect all metrics.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed. "allMetrics" includes all possible metrics for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable metric collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
Required. Name of the Application Gateway.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. The managed identity definition for this resource.
Optional. Authentication certificates of the application gateway resource.
Optional. Upper bound on number of Application Gateway capacity.
Optional. Lower bound on number of Application Gateway capacity.
Optional. Backend address pool of the application gateway resource.
Optional. Backend http settings of the application gateway resource.
Optional. Custom error configurations of the application gateway resource.
Optional. Whether FIPS is enabled on the application gateway resource.
Optional. Whether HTTP2 is enabled on the application gateway resource.
Optional. The resource ID of an associated firewall policy. Should be configured for security reasons.
Optional. Frontend IP addresses of the application gateway resource.
Optional. Frontend ports of the application gateway resource.
Optional. Subnets of the application gateway resource.
Optional. Enable request buffering.
Optional. Enable response buffering.
Optional. Http listeners of the application gateway resource.
Optional. Load distribution policies of the application gateway resource.
Optional. Configuration details for private endpoints. For security reasons, it is recommended to use private endpoints whenever possible.
Optional. PrivateLink configurations on application gateway.
Optional. Probes of the application gateway resource.
Optional. Redirect configurations of the application gateway resource.
Optional. Request routing rules of the application gateway resource.
Optional. Rewrite rules for the application gateway resource.
Optional. The name of the SKU for the Application Gateway.
Optional. The number of Application instances to be configured.
Optional. SSL certificates of the application gateway resource.
Optional. Ssl cipher suites to be enabled in the specified order to application gateway.
Optional. Ssl protocol enums.
Optional. Ssl predefined policy name enums.
Optional. Type of Ssl Policy.
Optional. SSL profiles of the application gateway resource.
Optional. Trusted client certificates of the application gateway resource.
Optional. Trusted Root certificates of the application gateway resource.
Optional. URL path map of the application gateway resource.
Optional. Application gateway web application firewall configuration. Should be configured for security reasons.
Optional. A list of availability zones denoting where the resource needs to come from.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Resource tags.

Optional. Backend settings of the application gateway resource. For default limits, see [Application Gateway limits](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-subscription-service-limits#application-gateway-limits).

Optional. Listeners of the application gateway resource. For default limits, see [Application Gateway limits](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-subscription-service-limits#application-gateway-limits).
Optional. Routing rules of the application gateway resource.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.

variables.formattedUserAssignedIdentities: [reduce(map(coalesce(tryGet(parameters('managedIdentities'), 'userAssignedResourceIds'), createArray()), lambda('id', createObject(format('{0}', lambdaVariables('id')), createObject()))), createObject(), lambda('cur', 'next', union(lambdaVariables('cur'), lambdaVariables('next'))))]

applicationGateway.name: [parameters('name')]
applicationGateway.properties: [union(createObject('authenticationCertificates', parameters('authenticationCertificates'), 'autoscaleConfiguration', if(and(greater(parameters('autoscaleMaxCapacity'), 0), greaterOrEquals(parameters('autoscaleMinCapacity'), 0)), createObject('maxCapacity', parameters('autoscaleMaxCapacity'), 'minCapacity', parameters('autoscaleMinCapacity')), null()), 'backendAddressPools', parameters('backendAddressPools'), 'backendHttpSettingsCollection', parameters('backendHttpSettingsCollection'), 'backendSettingsCollection', parameters('backendSettingsCollection'), 'customErrorConfigurations', parameters('customErrorConfigurations'), 'enableHttp2', parameters('enableHttp2'), 'firewallPolicy', if(not(empty(parameters('firewallPolicyResourceId'))), createObject('id', parameters('firewallPolicyResourceId')), null()), 'forceFirewallPolicyAssociation', not(empty(parameters('firewallPolicyResourceId'))), 'frontendIPConfigurations', parameters('frontendIPConfigurations'), 'frontendPorts', parameters('frontendPorts'), 'gatewayIPConfigurations', parameters('gatewayIPConfigurations'), 'globalConfiguration', if(endsWith(parameters('sku'), 'v2'), createObject('enableRequestBuffering', parameters('enableRequestBuffering'), 'enableResponseBuffering', parameters('enableResponseBuffering')), null()), 'httpListeners', parameters('httpListeners'), 'loadDistributionPolicies', parameters('loadDistributionPolicies'), 'listeners', parameters('listeners'), 'privateLinkConfigurations', parameters('privateLinkConfigurations'), 'probes', parameters('probes'), 'redirectConfigurations', parameters('redirectConfigurations'), 'requestRoutingRules', parameters('requestRoutingRules'), 'routingRules', parameters('routingRules'), 'rewriteRuleSets', parameters('rewriteRuleSets'), 'sku', createObject('name', parameters('sku'), 'tier', if(endsWith(parameters('sku'), 'v2'), parameters('sku'), substring(parameters('sku'), 0, indexOf(parameters('sku'), '_'))), 'capacity', if(and(greater(parameters('autoscaleMaxCapacity'), 0), greaterOrEquals(parameters('autoscaleMinCapacity'), 0)), null(), parameters('capacity'))), 'sslCertificates', parameters('sslCertificates'), 'sslPolicy', if(not(equals(parameters('sslPolicyType'), 'Predefined')), createObject('cipherSuites', parameters('sslPolicyCipherSuites'), 'minProtocolVersion', parameters('sslPolicyMinProtocolVersion'), 'policyName', if(empty(parameters('sslPolicyName')), null(), parameters('sslPolicyName')), 'policyType', parameters('sslPolicyType')), createObject('policyName', if(empty(parameters('sslPolicyName')), null(), parameters('sslPolicyName')), 'policyType', parameters('sslPolicyType'))), 'sslProfiles', parameters('sslProfiles'), 'trustedClientCertificates', parameters('trustedClientCertificates'), 'trustedRootCertificates', parameters('trustedRootCertificates'), 'urlPathMaps', parameters('urlPathMaps')), if(parameters('enableFips'), createObject('enableFips', parameters('enableFips')), createObject()), if(not(empty(parameters('webApplicationFirewallConfiguration'))), createObject('webApplicationFirewallConfiguration', parameters('webApplicationFirewallConfiguration')), createObject()))]

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

name.value: [coalesce(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'name'), format('pep-{0}-{1}-{2}', last(split(resourceId('Microsoft.Network/applicationGateways', parameters('name')), '/')), coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()].service, copyIndex()))]

parameters.privateLinkServiceConnections: [if(not(equals(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'isManualConnection'), true())), createObject('value', createArray(createObject('name', coalesce(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'privateLinkServiceConnectionName'), format('{0}-{1}-{2}', last(split(resourceId('Microsoft.Network/applicationGateways', parameters('name')), '/')), coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()].service, copyIndex())), 'properties', createObject('privateLinkServiceId', resourceId('Microsoft.Network/applicationGateways', parameters('name')), 'groupIds', createArray(coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()].service))))), createObject('value', null()))]
parameters.manualPrivateLinkServiceConnections: [if(equals(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'isManualConnection'), true()), createObject('value', createArray(createObject('name', coalesce(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'privateLinkServiceConnectionName'), format('{0}-{1}-{2}', last(split(resourceId('Microsoft.Network/applicationGateways', parameters('name')), '/')), coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()].service, copyIndex())), 'properties', createObject('privateLinkServiceId', resourceId('Microsoft.Network/applicationGateways', parameters('name')), 'groupIds', createArray(coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()].service), 'requestMessage', coalesce(tryGet(coalesce(parameters('privateEndpoints'), createArray())[copyIndex()], 'manualConnectionRequestMessage'), 'Manual approval required.'))))), createObject('value', null()))]

metadata.name: Private Endpoints
metadata.description: This module deploys a Private Endpoint.
Optional. The name of the Private DNS Zone Group.
Required. The private DNS zone groups to associate the private endpoint. A DNS zone group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Required. The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group.

Required. The ID of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to. If used with private link service connection, this property must be defined as empty string.

Required. The member name of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to. If used with private link service connection, this property must be defined as empty string.
Required. A private IP address obtained from the private endpoint's subnet.
Required. Properties of private endpoint IP configurations.
Required. The name of the private link service connection.

Required. The ID of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to. If used with private link service connection, this property must be defined as empty string array `[]`.
Required. The resource id of private link service.
Optional. A message passed to the owner of the remote resource with this connection request. Restricted to 140 chars.
Required. Properties of private link service connection.
Required. The name of the private link service connection.

Required. The ID of a group obtained from the remote resource that this private endpoint should connect to. If used with private link service connection, this property must be defined as empty string array `[]`.
Required. The resource id of private link service.
Optional. A message passed to the owner of the remote resource with this connection request. Restricted to 140 chars.
Required. Properties of private link service connection.
Required. Fqdn that resolves to private endpoint IP address.
Required. A list of private IP addresses of the private endpoint.
Optional. The name of the private DNS zone group config.
Required. The resource id of the private DNS zone.
Required. Name of the private endpoint resource to create.
Required. Resource ID of the subnet where the endpoint needs to be created.
Optional. Application security groups in which the private endpoint IP configuration is included.
Optional. The custom name of the network interface attached to the private endpoint.
Optional. A list of IP configurations of the private endpoint. This will be used to map to the First Party Service endpoints.
Optional. The private DNS zone group to configure for the private endpoint.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Tags to be applied on all resources/resource groups in this deployment.
Optional. Custom DNS configurations.
Optional. A grouping of information about the connection to the remote resource. Used when the network admin does not have access to approve connections to the remote resource.
Optional. A grouping of information about the connection to the remote resource.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Private Endpoint Private DNS Zone Groups
metadata.description: This module deploys a Private Endpoint Private DNS Zone Group.
Optional. The name of the private DNS zone group config.
Required. The resource id of the private DNS zone.
Conditional. The name of the parent private endpoint. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Array of private DNS zone configurations of the private DNS zone group. A DNS zone group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Optional. The name of the private DNS zone group.
The name of the private endpoint DNS zone group.
The resource ID of the private endpoint DNS zone group.
The resource group the private endpoint DNS zone group was deployed into.
The resource group the private endpoint was deployed into.
The resource ID of the private endpoint.
The name of the private endpoint.
The location the resource was deployed into.
The custom DNS configurations of the private endpoint.
The IDs of the network interfaces associated with the private endpoint.
The group Id for the private endpoint Group.
The name of the application gateway.
The resource ID of the application gateway.
The resource group the application gateway was deployed into.
The location the resource was deployed into.
The private endpoints of the application gateway.
